paper_abstract: A vertex subset F is a k-restricted vertex-cut of a connected graph G if G - F is disconnected and every vertex in G - F has at least k good neighbors in G - F. The cardinality of the minimum k-restricted vertex-cut of G is the k-restricted connectivity of G, denoted by K(k)(G). This parameter measures a kind of conditional fault tolerance of networks. In this paper, we show that for the n-dimensional alternating group graph AG(n), K(2) (AG(4)) = 4and K(2) (AG(n)) = 6n - 18 for n >= 5. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A kind of conditional fault tolerance of alternating group graphs
